page.title: 18Shopping in Royston
page.content: There is a variety of small shops in Royston and one supermarket. The main shopping street is the High Street,which has some old buildings and fairly narrow pavements.It is open to traffic.There are two small pedestrian precincts with quite modern shops.The open air market is held every Wednesday and Saturday.There are food shops and non-food shops. We did a survey in which we asked 90 families about their shopping.Most people said they could buy fresh food without difficulty,but that they travelled to Cambridge,Letchworth or Stevenage to buy clothes,shoes,freezer food or household goods.Royston was only rated a 'fair'shopping centre. A number of people wished the town had more department stores. Most people use a car for shopping and found parking difficult.
